seo.title: FAQ | SustainSage
seo.description: Clear answers about coaching scope, logistics, ethics, and organisational partnerships with SustainSage.

hero.title: Honest answers so you can decide what support fits now.
hero.body: We stay within ICF ethics: no promises, no pressure, and referrals when coaching is not the right container.

categories.title: About coaching
categories.intro: Scope, boundaries, and who tends to benefit from working with us.

items.question: What is coaching and how is it different from therapy or consulting?
items.answer: Coaching is a collaborative, future-leaning conversation. You set the agenda, we ask reflective questions, and we co-design experiments. Therapy diagnoses or treats mental health needs, while consultants provide directive plans—those stay outside coaching.

items.question: What does it mean that your work is ICF-aligned?
items.answer: We follow the International Coaching Federation Code of Ethics. That means informed consent, confidentiality with clear limits, data care, and regular check-ins on how our partnership is working for you.

items.question: Who usually benefits from coaching with you?
items.answer: Clients are often navigating relocation, career rebuilds, care responsibilities, or cross-cultural leadership. They want space to think, experiment, and name boundaries without being told what to do.

items.question: When might coaching not be the right support?
items.answer: If you need crisis intervention, clinical treatment, legal or financial advice, coaching is not sufficient. We can pause, signpost other professionals, or suggest resources that better match the support you need.

categories.title: Practicalities
categories.intro: What sessions look like, how often we meet, and how we handle logistics.

items.question: How many sessions do people usually book?
items.answer: Individuals often start with six sessions over two to three months. Organisations may commission three or six-month programmes. You can pause or extend after each review.

items.question: What formats and languages do you offer?
items.answer: Sessions run on Zoom by default. We coach in English and Mandarin, and you can switch languages in the moment if that helps you express nuance.

items.question: What are your fees?
items.answer: Personal packages range from £420 to £1,200 depending on length. Organisation-sponsored coaching starts from £1,800 for a three-month engagement. Sliding scale options are discussed during the intro chat.

items.question: What is your cancellation policy?
items.answer: You can reschedule with 24 hours’ notice. Late cancellations or no-shows count as a session so we can protect time for all clients.

categories.title: Ethics & safety
categories.intro: How we hold confidentiality, handle risk, and care for your information.

items.question: How confidential are our sessions?
items.answer: Sessions stay between us except when there is risk of harm or a legal duty to disclose. We agree on how notes are stored, who can access them, and when they are deleted.

items.question: What happens if mental health concerns show up?
items.answer: We pause, name what we are noticing, and co-create a plan. That could involve referrals to therapists, crisis services, or other professionals alongside—or instead of—coaching.

items.question: Do you work with safeguarding or legal obligations?
items.answer: Yes. We comply with UK safeguarding guidance and the ICF Code of Ethics. If a disclosure meets reporting thresholds, we inform you of the steps we must take and support you through the process.

categories.title: For organisations
categories.intro: How we partner with employers, schools, and sponsors while protecting coachee autonomy.

items.question: How do you structure organisation-sponsored coaching?
items.answer: We start with a three-way meeting to confirm goals, boundaries, and feedback loops. The coachee leads session agendas while sponsors receive high-level progress updates agreed in advance.

items.question: What information do sponsors receive?
items.answer: Sponsors hear themes, not session detail. No personal stories are shared without written consent, and safeguarding or risk concerns are handled directly with the coachee first wherever possible.

items.question: Can you support teams across time zones?
items.answer: Yes. We work with teams across Europe and Asia-Pacific using online sessions, shared notes, and agreed review points. Time zones are planned collaboratively during onboarding.

cta.title: Still unsure?
cta.body: Share your context and we will confirm whether coaching, a referral, or another resource will serve you best. Your clarity matters more than filling a slot.

fallbackNotice: 目前暫以英文內容呈現，完整翻譯即將補上。
